trans-unit.source: Step 1: Configure the Build Server
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Configure the Build Server

trans-unit.source: Before you can create an Azure package by using MSBuild, you must
trans-unit.target: Before you can create an Azure package by using MSBuild, you must

trans-unit.source: install the required software and tools on the build server.
trans-unit.target: install the required software and tools on the build server.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio is not required to be installed on the build server.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio is not required to be installed on the build server.

trans-unit.source: If
trans-unit.target: If

trans-unit.source: you want to use Team Foundation Build Service to manage your build
trans-unit.target: you want to use Team Foundation Build Service to manage your build

trans-unit.source: server, follow the instructions in the [Team Foundation Build Service][]
trans-unit.target: server, follow the instructions in the [Team Foundation Build Service][]

trans-unit.source: documentation.
trans-unit.target: documentation.

trans-unit.source: On the build server, install the [.NET Framework 4][], [.NET Framework 4.5][], or [.NET Framework 4.5.2][], which include MSBuild.
trans-unit.target: On the build server, install the [.NET Framework 4][], [.NET Framework 4.5][], or [.NET Framework 4.5.2][], which include MSBuild.

trans-unit.source: Install the [Azure Authoring Tools for .NET](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=623518) (substitute MicrosoftAzureAuthoringTools-x86.msi in the link instead of MicrosoftAzureAuthoringTools-x64.msi if your build server has a 32-bit OS/processor).
trans-unit.target: Install the [Azure Authoring Tools for .NET](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=623518) (substitute MicrosoftAzureAuthoringTools-x86.msi in the link instead of MicrosoftAzureAuthoringTools-x64.msi if your build server has a 32-bit OS/processor).

trans-unit.source: Install the [Azure Libraries for .NET](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=623519) (substitute MicrosoftAzureLibsForNet-x86.msi in the link if needed).
trans-unit.target: Install the [Azure Libraries for .NET](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=623519) (substitute MicrosoftAzureLibsForNet-x86.msi in the link if needed).

trans-unit.source: Copy the Microsoft.WebApplication.targets file from a Visual Studio installation to the build server.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Microsoft.WebApplication.targets file from a Visual Studio installation to the build server.

trans-unit.source: On a computer with Visual Studio installed, this file is located in the directory C:\\Program Files(x86)\\MSBuild\\Microsoft\\VisualStudio\\v14.0\\WebApplications (v12.0 for Visual Studio 2013).
trans-unit.target: On a computer with Visual Studio installed, this file is located in the directory C:\\Program Files(x86)\\MSBuild\\Microsoft\\VisualStudio\\v14.0\\WebApplications (v12.0 for Visual Studio 2013).

trans-unit.source: You should copy it to the same directory on the build server.
trans-unit.target: You should copy it to the same directory on the build server.

trans-unit.source: Install the [Azure Tools for Visual Studio](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=623520).
trans-unit.target: Install the [Azure Tools for Visual Studio](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=623520).

trans-unit.source: Use MicrosoftAzureTools.VS140.exe to build Visual Studio 2015 projects, or MicrosoftAzureTools.VS120.exe to build Visual Studio 2013 projects.
trans-unit.target: Use MicrosoftAzureTools.VS140.exe to build Visual Studio 2015 projects, or MicrosoftAzureTools.VS120.exe to build Visual Studio 2013 projects.
